text: Kenneth Douglas "Ken" Taylor, OC (October 5, 1934 â€“ October 15, 2015) was a Canadian diplomat, educator and businessman. He was best known for his role in the 1979 covert operation called the "Canadian Caper" which helped free some hostages during the Iran hostage crisis. Taylor died in New York City from colon cancer at the age of 81. ==References== ==Other websites== * Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada Complete List of Posts Category:1934 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Ambassadors of Canada Category:Canadian businesspeople Category:Academics of the University of Toronto Category:University of Toronto alumni Category:Congressional Gold Medal recipients Category:Politicians from Calgary
title: Kenneth D. Taylor
